title: Ticket #4262: Java Test Enhancements Revisit
description:
Took a deep look at java and java tests on windows. None we very clear about what they were doing in their output. I finally deduced our issue on windows 8 was HTCondor runs 32 bits and could not easily access a 64 bit java.

Though there are no new tests, there is ne functionality.

We want to fail immediately if we do not find a java, we want to set a timed callback in case the job does not run and we want to scrape the starter log for JavaDetect if we do timeout.
check_ins:
2014-Mar-17 18:48   Check-in [39652]: These tests all do the new test JavaInitialize and some got their output cleaned up some. None of the actual java or class files changed. #4262 (By Bill Taylor )
2014-Mar-17 18:42   Check-in [39651]: Besides the removal of is_windows, We wanted to better handle java tests. There are two function and we only call one. JavaInitialize will look for java and return it. This alllows tests to fail immediately if java is missing and we'll know why we failed. The other thing it does is establish a timeout [...] (By Bill Taylor )
2014-Mar-17 18:38   Check-in [39650]: wanted a way to to search the StarterLog when a java test times out for all JavaDetect events. So now you can pass an optional third arg. If you set all to an array hash, the search will now fill it.#4262 (By Bill Taylor )
2014-Mar-17 18:35   Check-in [39649]: On windows, add cygwin and windows paths to PATH for the 64 bit app location so when we check for having java in JavaInitialize we will seee it and not immediately bail #4262 (By Bill Taylor )
creator: bt
